column1: Menifee has mild winters and hot dry Summers.
The highest recorded temperature was 117 °F (47 °C) on June 20
The lowest recorded temperature was 18 °F (−8 °C) on January 1

The maximum average precipitation occurs in February.Menifee has a Mediterranean climate or Dry-Summer Subtropical (Köppen climate classification Csa). Menifee enjoys plenty of sunshine throughout the year
column2: with an average of 263 sunshine days and only 35 days with measurable precipitation annually of 12.51" inches of rainfall.The period of April through October is hot and dry with average high temperatures of 83 to 101 °F (28 to 38 °C) and lows of 42 to 66 °F (6 to 19 °C)

column1: Elementary and middle school level education in Menifee is provided by the Menifee Union School District and Romoland School District
column2: which serves most of Menifee as well as parts of Lake Elsinore
column4: and the unincorporated community of French Valley. High school students attend school in the Perris Union High School District
column5: which includes Paloma Valley High School and Heritage High School.

column1: Menifee is also home to the Menifee Valley Campus of Mt. San Jacinto College
column3: Murrieta and Menifee areas and is known as the fastest-growing community college in California. There
column4: students can take the classes necessary in order to transfer to four-year college institutions. The community college also has an award-winning nursing program for those wanting to become Registered Nurses. The MSJC Nursing Department has pathways from MSJC directly to Loma Linda Medical Center
column7: and Inland Valley Medical Center. Brandman University
column8: which is part of the Chapman University System
column9: has opened on the MSJC campus to offer Menifee its first four-year college and is accompanied by Grand Canyon University and Bellevue University.

column3: the City of Menifee ended its contract with the Riverside County Sheriff Department and started its own municipal police department. The Menifee Police Department is lead by Chief of Police Pat Walsh.

column1: The City of Menifee contracts for fire and paramedic services with the Riverside County Fire Department through a cooperative agreement with CAL FIRE. There are four fire stations in Menifee and each station has a paramedic engine company
column2: and there is one medic patrol unit out of Fire Station #7 to assist with call volumes
column3: as Station #7 is the 10th-busiest station in the nation. The Menifee Lakes station also has a truck company located there with specialized equipment for large structural fires.

column1: Paramedic services are provided by American Medical Response
column2: which has their South Riverside Headquarters located in Menifee.
